title: I have heard riot say that jail doesn't work but why does it work in other games?
body: The best example I can give is killer instincts jail system where if you afk too much you are just flat out locked out of ranked. Hell I hear that even overwatch does the same sort of thing.

replies.body: That isn't the "jail" they are talking about. The concept of a "Prisoner's Island" isn't the inability to play, it's putting them in their own queue with each other, and the reason they say it doesn't work *for them* is because it is really bad for reforming players, which is what Riot is trying to accomplish.

The concept of a "Prisoner's Island" isn't the inability to play, it's putting them in their own queue with each other, and the reason they say it doesn't work *for them* is because it is really bad for reforming players, which is what Riot is trying to accomplish.

Did they ever try and test out that theory? I'm interested to know more if they did o-o
People ended up trolling in normal games instead, which wasn't cool either.

They did have Ranked Restrictions before they phased out the Tribunal. Sure it took some toxic players out of Ranked for the duration, but it wasn't a cool deal for the Normals players (you had to win X normal games to work off the restriction).

I'm starting to pray for a full on zero tolerance policy. Like a one and done sorta thing. I mean sure a lot of people are gonna get removed along the way but I feel like at this point its the only clear way to do it. Hell I wouldn't mind having my own account banned from this ideology since I support it. Just at this point I don't think any other option will truly remove the problem.

I wanna say if anything thats probably the main reason why they stopped it. When you have something like this, you are basically saying its fine to do it in Normals (or any other mode than Rank) and for people who mainly play those other modes its not fair. As someone who mainly plays Normals, I sure as hell wouldnt want trolls just for the sake of them getting back into Rank.
